discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Agree with A

questions.question_text: An administrator is troubleshooting a Cisco Jabber Deskphone Control issue. Which CTI event from the log denotes that the request from Jabber to CTI Manager must the administrator check?
An engineer must verify that the DNS SRV entries that are configured have the correct information. How is this configuration completed via a Windows machine?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

choices.D: Go to Windows Explorer and type nslookup. Set the type=internet and then enter the SRV record.
choices.A: Go to the command prompt and type nslookup. Set the type=srv, and then enter the SRV record.
choices.B: Go to Internet Explorer and type nslookup. Set the type=srv, and then enter the SRV record.
choices.C: Go to the command prompt and type dnslookup. Set the type=sip, and then enter the SRV record.

choices.A: Assign the user to a different Presence Redundancy Group.
choices.B: Set the Owner ID on the user’s desk phone.
choices.D: Associate the user to the line on the Directory Number Configuration page.

questions.question_text: An engineer is assisting a user who is reporting Jabber Presence issues. Whenever the user is on an active call, Cisco Jabber does not show the user as active when on a call. However, the user can set the presence status manually, and that status shows correctly. Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Agree with D

Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D

Selected Answer: C
C looks correct

choices.C: Presence Redundancy Group Configuration > High Availability > click Fallback.
choices.D: BLF Presence Group Configuration > High Availability > click Fallback.
choices.B: BLF Presence Group Configuration > High Availability > select the publisher server > click Restart Services.
choices.A: Cisco UCM Group Configuration > High Availability > click Fallback.

questions.question_text: A network engineer needs to configure high availability on the Cisco IM and Presence cluster. After the configuration was completed and tested, the engineer noticed on Cisco UCM that the IM and Presence publisher is in “Failed Over” state. Which set of steps must be taken to resolve this issue?

An administrator is configuring Cisco Unity Connection call handlers. The administrator wants to ensure that all outside callers are played a welcome message and then are transferred to a live operator. The administrator wants to restrict the callers from interrupting the welcome message with key presses. Under which call handler menu is this task accomplished?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A should be the right answer

Selected Answer: A
should be A

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D

D. Caller Input would block buttons from being pressed, however that would basically block the caller from ever hitting a button so A. is correct. (Greetings) you can make sure callers do not have option to hit buttons. "During Greeting" -- Ignore Caller Input is the option used to ignore while playing the greeting.
